name: dnsmasq
desc:
Dnsmasq provides network infrastructure for small networks: DNS, 
DHCP, router advertisement and network boot. It is designed to be 
lightweight and have a small footprint, suitable for resource 
constrained routers and firewalls. It has also been widely used 
for tethering on smartphones and portable hotspots, and to support 
virtual networking in virtualisation frameworks. Supported platforms 
include Linux (with glibc and uclibc), Android, *BSD, and Mac OS X. 
Dnsmasq is included in most Linux distributions and the 
ports systems of FreeBSD, OpenBSD and NetBSD. Dnsmasq provides full 
IPv6 support.
